pullRequest.body:
We compute the values of the volumes used in `CanonicalEmbedding`. In particular, we prove that
```lean
volume (fundamentalDomain (latticeBasis K)) =
       (2 : ‚Ñù‚â•0‚àû)‚Åª¬π ^ (NrComplexPlaces K) * NNReal.sqrt ‚Äñdiscr K‚Äñ‚Çä
```

This will be useful later on to prove Hermite and Hermite-Minkowski theorems.

---

bors d+
Does `NNReal.sqrt` exist? If so, you can use `|discr K|\_+` (subscript +) to take the norm as nnreal, and then you don't need the `Real.toNNReal` later on.
I changed the statement and the proof. It does look cleaner that way.

```suggestion
representation of `commMap K x` on `stdBasis` is given (up to reindexing) by the product of
```
Preferably this name would not have `_` in it. What do you think of `commMapMatrix`? Or `matrixToStdBasis`?

Should `Fintype.card { w : InfinitePlace K // IsComplex w }` get a name? It would improve readability of this statement. Maybe
```
abbrev NrComplexPlaces := Fintype.card { w : InfinitePlace K // IsComplex w }
```
or something like that?

That's actually a very good idea since these numbers show up at many places and will show up even more in forthcoming PRs. I was almost tempted to call them r‚ÇÅ and r‚ÇÇ but I guess your suggestion `NrRealPlaces` and `NrComplexPlaces` is more explicit.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: explicit volume computations in NumberTheory.NumberField.CanonicalEmbedding
